Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 09:50AM janno wrote: interesting to read all of your personal stories regarding this issue.  I met with my Rad Onc yesterday hoping to 'opt' out of the radiation.  I have had a left total mastectomy with immediate reconstruction (tissue expander) and am currently into my second chemo (2 of 6) FECD.....18 lymph nodes were taken with 4 effected.  My rad onc said that it is very risky to NOT do the rads.........altho' here I am with an 'almost fully expanded expander'......and all the complications arising from that really has me overwhelmed.  I have major travel issues to meet the daily treatment for 6 weeks............I have serious concerns about lymphedema........and all the other SE's that people here have referred to.  My rad onc actually informed me yesterday that the 'old' thinking of not prescribing rads to nodes 1-3 has now been revisited and ALL node involvement BC is being prescribed rads.  Wouldn't you think that more 'council' pre surgery for reconstruction would be beneficial to us all?  Why are we having to deal with the added stress of a 'in progress' reconstruction and it's complications when we obviously have enough to be concerned about........I don't know specifically what the rad onc and the PS will work out should I decide to proceed with the rads..........but it was hinted that the expander would have to come out after my chemo..........and before rads............ARRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRGH!  I am a little scared..........frustrated..........and would welcome any replies that could help me make this most important decision.  Peace.
Posts.Title: Decision Criteria for Radiation;Risks;Reconstruction Issues nurlaw LynnVA
